title: Implement --context flag for spawn
description: Add context files injection to spawn command for priming sessions with relevant files

title: Create 'coders attach' command for direct PTY
description:
Replace or augment the tmux-based attach command with direct PTY attach.

Requirements:
1. coders attach <session-id> connects directly to PTY
2. Uses same approach as ptytest (raw mode, bidirectional I/O)
3. Proper terminal size handling (SIGWINCH)
4. Clean exit with Ctrl+]
5. Works with sessions from new SessionManager

BLOCKED: Requires session persistence (coders-nja) to have sessions to attach to.
Without a daemon holding sessions, there's nothing to attach to - PTY sessions
only exist while the spawn process runs in the foreground.

Alternative path: TUI integration (coders-9wv) can hold sessions, making this
work within the TUI context.

title: Set up GitHub Actions for CI/CD

Goals:
- Understand nelson's architecture and approach

close_reason: Completed comprehensive analysis of Nelson repo. Created detailed findings document at packages/go/NELSON_ANALYSIS.md covering architecture, innovative features, and integration recommendations for Coders project.

title: No-tmux rewrite: Direct PTY management for seamless passthrough
description:
Investigate and implement a rewrite that eliminates tmux dependency. The goal is seamless keystroke passthrough to CLI tools (claude, codex, etc) without the latency and complexity of tmux send-keys.

## Motivation
- tmux send-keys has inherent latency
- Control mode helps but still causes UI flicker
- Direct PTY management could provide true seamless input

## Key requirements
1. Spawn CLI tools directly with PTY
2. Seamless keystroke forwarding (no perceived latency)
3. Capture and display output in TUI
4. Support multiple concurrent sessions
5. Session persistence (survive TUI restart)

## Research areas
- Go PTY libraries (creack/pty, etc)
- Terminal multiplexer architectures (how tmux/screen work)
- Bubbletea terminal embedding
- Session persistence without tmux

title: Fix homebrew tap repository not found error
description:
Investigate and fix homebrew tap failure.

Error:
```
brew tap Jayphen/coders
==> Tapping jayphen/coders
Cloning into '/opt/homebrew/Library/Taps/jayphen/homebrew-coders'...
remote: Repository not found.
fatal: repository 'https://github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders/' not found
Error: Failure while executing; \`git clone https://github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders /opt/homebrew/Library/Taps/jayphen/homebrew-coders --origin=origin --template= --config core.fsmonitor=false\` exited with 128.
```

Investigation steps:
- Check if homebrew-coders repository exists on GitHub
- If not, create the repository at https://github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders
- Set up proper homebrew formula structure
- Test tap installation works
- Update documentation with correct installation instructions

This blocks the Homebrew formula task (coders-yj4)
close_reason:
Fixed: Created homebrew-coders tap repository at https://github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders

The issue was that Homebrew taps require a separate repository with the 'homebrew-' prefix. When users ran 'brew tap Jayphen/coders', Homebrew looked for 'github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders' which didn't exist.

Solution:
- Created new repository: github.com/Jayphen/homebrew-coders
- Copied coders.rb formula and README.md from main repo
- Pushed to GitHub and verified tap works correctly
- Created HOMEBREW_TAP_SETUP.md with full documentation

Users can now install via:
  brew tap Jayphen/coders
  brew install coders

Or directly:
  brew install Jayphen/coders/coders

title: Fix TUI passthrough mode flickering
description:
Passthrough mode in TUI preview has flickering issues when typing. Keys are sent with low latency via tmux control mode, but the preview refresh causes UI flicker.

## Problem
When in passthrough mode, the UI flickers/jumps ~10 pixels vertically on each keystroke or refresh.

## What we've tried
1. **tmux control mode** - Replaced exec per keystroke with persistent control connection. Keys send in ~18µs vs 57ms. ✅ Fixed latency, but flicker remains.

2. **Fast polling (50ms)** - Refreshed preview every 50ms. Caused heavy flicker.

3. **On-demand refresh** - Only refresh after keystroke with 30-100ms delay. Still flickers.

4. **Skip refresh if content unchanged** - Added check `if m.preview != msg.output`. Helped slightly.

5. **Debouncing** - Track `passthroughPending` to only schedule one refresh per 100ms window. Reduced flicker but didn't eliminate.

6. **Clear status message** - Set `m.statusMessage = ""` during passthrough to stabilize view state. Minor improvement.

7. **Fixed height view** - Used `lipgloss.Place(width, height, ...)` to anchor view to terminal size. Still flickers.

## Suspected causes
- Bubbletea re-renders on every Update() call regardless of view changes
- Something in header/status bar changing height between renders
- View caching not working properly (statusExpired computed with time.Now())

## Potential solutions to explore
- Use Bubbletea viewport component for preview (isolates scrolling)
- Investigate what's changing between renders with debug logging
- Try tea.WithoutRenderer and manual ANSI cursor positioning
- Consider not refreshing preview at all during passthrough (accept stale view)
- Profile View() output to find what's different between frames

title: Integrate TermViewModel into main TUI
description:
Wire the TermViewModel component into the main TUI to replace tmux capture-pane based preview.

Requirements:
1. Replace current preview pane with TermViewModel
2. Session list shows sessions from new SessionManager (not tmux)
3. Preview displays live PTY output
4. Focus mode forwards keystrokes directly to PTY
5. Ctrl+] or similar to exit focus mode

Reference:
- packages/go/internal/tui/termview.go (component)
- packages/go/internal/session/manager.go (session manager)
- packages/go/cmd/coders/ptytest.go (working example)
close_reason:
Integrated PTY sessions into TUI:
- Added SessionManager to TUI Model
- PTY sessions appear in session list with ⚡ indicator
- Preview fetches from PTY output buffer
- Send keys works with PTY sessions via focus mode
- Kill session handles PTY sessions
- Spawn with --pty creates sessions held by TUI process

Usage: In TUI spawn dialog, use 'claude --pty --task "my task"' to create a PTY session.

title: Investigate replacing tmux with alternative solutions
description:
Evaluate whether replacing tmux is feasible or useful for the coders project.

Goals:
- Identify tmux pain points in current implementation
- Research alternatives (zellij, screen, custom process management, etc.)
- Evaluate feasibility of migration
- Assess benefits vs migration costs
- Consider platform compatibility (macOS, Linux)
- Document recommendations

Context:
- Current implementation heavily relies on tmux for session management
- Need to understand what features we actually use from tmux
- Consider user experience improvements
close_reason: Completed comprehensive analysis. Recommendation: Keep tmux. Created detailed analysis document at packages/go/tmux-replacement-analysis.md covering pain points, alternatives (Zellij, Screen, custom), cost-benefit analysis, and recommendations for incremental improvements instead of full replacement.

title: Notify parent session when loop completes
description:
When a loop completes, notify the session that started it:

1. Track parent session ID (already have CODERS_SESSION_ID env var)
2. On loop completion, send notification via:
   - tmux display-message to parent session
   - Optional: OS native notification (osascript/notify-send)
   - Optional: bell character for visual alert

This enables better workflow when running loops from within coders -
the coder knows when its sub-loop finished without polling.
close_reason: Loop completed - implemented notifyLoopComplete with tmux display-message and OS-native notifications (osascript/notify-send)

title: Research Go PTY libraries and terminal multiplexer patterns
description:
Research how to implement direct PTY management in Go:

1. Evaluate Go PTY libraries:
   - github.com/creack/pty (most popular)
   - github.com/pkg/term
   - Others

2. Study terminal multiplexer architectures:
   - How tmux manages multiple PTYs
   - How screen does it
   - Session persistence mechanisms

3. Research Bubbletea terminal embedding:
   - Can we embed a terminal view in Bubbletea?
   - How to forward keystrokes to a PTY
   - Output capture and display

4. Document findings and recommend approach

Output: A design document with recommended architecture

title: Implement PTY session manager
description:
Create a session manager that handles PTY lifecycle:

1. SessionManager struct with:
   - Map of session ID to PTY
   - Spawn new session with PTY
   - Kill session
   - List active sessions

2. PTY wrapper that provides:
   - Write (send keystrokes)
   - Read (capture output)
   - Resize handling
   - Clean shutdown

3. Session state persistence:
   - Save session metadata to disk/Redis
   - Reconnect to running processes on TUI restart
   - Handle orphaned processes

Must work without tmux - direct PTY management only.

title: Raw keystroke forwarding in TUI preview mode
description:
Instead of buffering input and sending via tmux send-keys on Enter, forward individual keystrokes to the tmux pane in real-time. This enables Claude Code's native features:

- Tab completion for file paths
- Slash command autocomplete
- History navigation (up/down)
- Readline editing (ctrl+a, ctrl+e, etc.)

Implementation approach:
1. When user focuses preview pane, enter 'passthrough' mode
2. Forward each keystroke directly to tmux pane via send-keys
3. User sees autocomplete suggestions appear in the preview
4. Need escape hatch to exit passthrough mode (e.g., Ctrl+] or Esc Esc)
5. Consider showing a visual indicator when in passthrough mode

Tradeoffs to consider:
- Loses custom input field styling
- Focus/escape handling needs care
- Becomes more like 'inline attach' than 'send a message'

title: Add --wait flag to loop command for recursive loops
description:
Add --wait flag that makes the loop command block until all tasks complete.

Enables recursive loops where a coder spawned by a loop can spawn its own sub-loop:
- Coder analyzes big task
- Breaks into subtasks, writes todolist
- Runs: coders loop --wait --todolist subtasks.txt
- Blocks until all subtasks complete
- Continues with main work, publishes promise

This enables task decomposition trees where work fans out and promises bubble up.

title: Implement session persistence without tmux
description:
Ensure sessions survive TUI restarts without tmux:

Options to explore:
1. Background daemon that owns PTYs
   - TUI connects to daemon via socket
   - Daemon persists across TUI restarts
   
2. Process reparenting
   - Detach PTY from TUI process
   - Re-attach on restart
   
3. Socket-based PTY sharing
   - Use Unix sockets to share PTY access
   - Multiple clients can connect

4. Screen/tmux as optional backend
   - Keep tmux as opt-in for persistence
   - Direct PTY for low-latency mode

Implement chosen approach with tests.

title: Smart orchestrator with multi-source task input
description:
Orchestrator should intelligently handle tasks from multiple sources:
- txt/md todolist files (current)
- beads issues (bd list --status open)
- Linear issues
- GitHub issues
- Any other task source

When spawning loops, orchestrator should:
1. Normalize tasks from any source into common format
2. Track provenance (which source each task came from)
3. Update original source on completion (close beads, check markdown, update Linear)
4. Support mixing sources in a single loop

Keep loop runner simple - orchestrator handles the intelligence.
close_reason: Implemented multi-source task input system with support for todolist, beads, Linear, and GitHub sources

title: Implement embedded terminal view in TUI
description:
Create a Bubbletea component that displays PTY output and forwards input:

1. Terminal view component:
   - Renders PTY output with ANSI support
   - Fixed viewport with scrolling
   - Cursor positioning

2. Input handling:
   - When focused, ALL keystrokes go to PTY
   - Escape sequence to exit focus (e.g., Ctrl+] or dedicated key)
   - Zero perceived latency

3. Integration with TUI:
   - Session list on left
   - Terminal view on right
   - Seamless focus switching

Consider using:
- github.com/charmbracelet/x/exp/term for terminal emulation
- Custom ANSI parser for output rendering

title: Replace tmux spawn with direct PTY spawn
description:
Update the spawn command to use direct PTY instead of tmux.

Requirements:
1. coders spawn should create a PTY session via SessionManager
2. Session should be tracked in memory (and optionally persisted)
3. --attach flag should work with direct PTY attach
4. Backward compatibility: maybe keep tmux as fallback with --tmux flag

This enables the no-tmux workflow where sessions are managed directly.
close_reason: Implemented --pty flag for direct PTY spawn. When used, spawns the CLI tool with direct PTY management (no tmux), providing zero-latency keystroke forwarding. The session runs in the foreground and can be exited with Ctrl+]. Future work: session persistence (coders-nja) will enable detach/reattach without tmux.
